briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Adjunctive Zonisamide in Paediatric Partial Onset Seizures (CATZ Study)
officialTitle: A Double-blind, Randomised, Placebo-controlled, Multi-centre Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Adjunctive Zonisamide in Paediatric Partial Onset Seizures
summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of zonisamide with placebo.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Decrease From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency of =50%(Responder) in the Maintenance Period(LOCF)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (Week -8 to Week 0), and Week 8 to Week 20
